required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Health Effects of CArdiac FluoRoscopy and MOderN RadIotherapy in PediatriCs - Radiotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Health Effects of CArdiac FluoRoscopy and MOderN RadIotherapy in PediatriCs - Radiotherapy (HARMONIC-RT)

lead_sponsor.agency: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

collaborator.agency: The West German Proton Therapy Centre, Essen
Gustave Roussy, Cancer Campus, Grand Paris
Princess Maxima Center for Pediatric Oncology
National Research Council, Institute of Clinical Physiology, Italy
Luxembourg Institute of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of the HARMONIC-RT study is to evaluate late health and social outcomes of modern external beam radiotherapy techniques in paediatric patients, based on the setting-up of a European, long-term registry complemented by a biobank.

primary_outcome.description: Late health outcomes Neurovascular diseases Second and subsequent primary neaoplasms

primary_outcome.measure: Health-related quality of life (physical, emotional, social, and school functioning) assessed by the PedsQL™ core scale (validated questionnaire)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 10 years after radiation therapy or attained age 25 years, whichever occurs first
up to 10 years after radiation therapy or attained age 25 years, whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 10 years after radiation therapy
secondary_outcome.description: measured as: insulin-like growth factor-1, anterior pituitary hormones (GH, ACTH, TSH, LH, FSH), thyroid hormones (fT3, fT4), sexual hormones

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood markers of cardiovascular diseases
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 10 years after radiation therapy
secondary_outcome.description: measured as blood markers (incl. troponin, BNP, CPK)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in imaging markers of cardiovascular diseases
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 10 years after radiation therapy
secondary_outcome.description: measured as cardiac echography parameters (incl. ejection fraction, diastolic function)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in imaging markers of neurovascular damages
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 5 years after radiation therapy
secondary_outcome.description: measured as scoring of large and small vessel damages

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood/saliva markers of protein activation relating to vascular damages
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 year after radiation therapy
secondary_outcome.description: measured as signal quality of protein activity

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood/saliva markers of oxidative stress response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 year after radiation therapy
secondary_outcome.description: measured as markers of oxidative stress (incl. 8-oxo-dG, SOD2, DNA repair enzymes)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood/saliva markers of inflammatory response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 year after radiation therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Inflammatory markers (incl. PTX3, CRP, NF-kB, IL-1 and IL10)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood/saliva markers of carcinogenesis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 year after radiation therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Markers of carcinogenesis (incl. leukocyte telomere length, mitochondrial DNA copy number, circulating microRNA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Multidimensional fatigue (general, sleep/rest, and cognitive fatigue)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 10 years after radiation therapy or attained age 25 years, whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical events other than those mentioned as primary outcomes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 20 years after radiation therapy
up to 20 years after radiation therapy

biospec_descr.textblock: blood plasma; blood serum; lymphocytes; saliva

study_pop.textblock: Children, adolescents and young adults treated with external beam radiation therapy for a first primary neoplasm

criteria.textblock:
Retrospective inclusion of study participants
Inclusion Criteria:
- First external beam radiation therapy (EBRT) started in 2000 or after for management of a first primary neoplasm
- Age under 22 years at the time of first EBRT initiation
- Radiation treatment plan (first EBRT) stored in DICOM format
- Usual residency in the country of EBRT to enable a long-term follow-up
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with poor prognosis (e.g. diffuse pontine glioma or high grade glioma) at first EBRT initiation
- Prior external or internal radiation therapy
- Patients who refused to participate in the study
Prospective inclusion of study participants
Inclusion Criteria:
- Scheduled first EBRT for management of a first primary neoplasm
- Age under 22 years at the time of scheduled first EBRT
- Radiation treatment plan stored in DICOM format
- Affiliate or beneficiary of health insurance (or any required equivalent as defined in applicable national law)
- Usual residency in the country of EBRT to enable a long-term follow-up
- Signed informed consent/assent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with poor prognosis (e.g. diffuse pontine glioma or high grade glioma)
- Prior external or internal radiation therapy;
- Protected adults (persons under curatorship, tutorship / individuals under guardianship by court order, persons deprived of their liberty)
- Adult/parent(s)/legal representative(s) who cannot read or understand the informed consent in the applicable language(s) in the country of EBRT

facility.name: University Hospital Essen, The West German Proton Therapy Centre Essen
